title: Remove years of experience from personas
description: Replace year ranges (e.g., '4-8 Years') with alternative anchors: scope of impact, nature of contribution, and/or 'question you're trusted to answer'. Decided: remove entirely, use non-time-based anchors.

title: Roleplay: handling genuine belief of higher level
description: User will write up a conversation example for analysis. BLOCKED on user input. Can inform FAQ content.

title: Articulate non-people-leadership scaling paths (IC track)
description: How do ICs scale impact without leading teams? Valid paths: platforms, tooling, standards-setting, external influence. Reference Trident Model. ALSO depends on: Is influence the key differentiator (not just Consulting)?

title: Add explicit acknowledgment for people who don't fit
description: Message for people outside the framework's scope: 'This is designed for delivery roles. Other roles have different growth paths. We're expanding coverage. For now, talk to your office lead.'

title: Determine if all five capabilities apply equally to everyone
description: Do specialists need the same Consulting bar as client-facing roles? Can someone be 'spikey' (exceptional in 2-3, adequate in others)? This decision affects how we handle uneven growth and IC paths.

title: Define how to handle uneven growth across capabilities
description: Someone is Catalyst-level in Technical but Artisan-level in Consulting. What are they? Options: lowest bar, primary/secondary capabilities, no single label, persona as aspiration. Leaning toward primary/secondary but needs more thought.

title: Add FAQ or guidance for tricky situations
description: Cover scenarios: 'What if I disagree with calibration?', 'How do I know if my skills transfer?', 'What if I haven't had opportunity to demonstrate a capability?' Reframes and guidance for navigating these conversations.

title: Reframe Consulting language to clarify it's about calibration difficulty not importance
Address calibration bias toward visible work
description: Group calibration at 30-50 people may favor visible/high-profile work over important-but-invisible contributions. Need mechanisms to surface less visible impact.

title: Ensure framework doesn't become transactional
description: Critical concern: framework becoming a salary negotiation toolkit or checkbox exercise. Need to embed relational framing in language. Evidence as 'material for conversation' not 'ammunition'. This affects HOW we write everything else â€” must resolve early.

title: Clarify what Consulting capability entails vs influence broadly
close_reason: Resolved: Consulting is called out because it's where self-assessment is most unreliable, not because it's more important. All five capabilities matter equally.

title: Revisit: Is Mentorship a distinct capability?
description: Question whether Mentorship is standalone or expression of other capabilities. User believes it's distinct. Revisit later if needed. Lower priority.

title: Finalize naming: Field Guide to Growing Impact
description: Current title: 'The Sahaj Field Guide to Growth & Impact'. Candidates: 'Growing Impact', just 'Impact'. Growth implies ladder but compensation is tied anyway, so may be honest to include it.
